column4: I would be a bit surprised to have no way to do it in kubuntu as it was fairly trivial in freebsd to do this
but mcphail said there was no way ... wonder what makes it so difficult
I have an amd64 OS installed and want to migrate to an x86 OS in-place (I'm out of spare disks)
do you have lots of customized stuff yet? (configs, personal files, etc)
alright, should I save that to a file somewhere?
about 2GB on one and 8GB free on the one that I have ubuntu installed on
hmm ... how much data do you need to back up?
here's a bad idea ... change the repos to the 32bit ones and then apt-get distupgrade ...
I would not try the above
eh? are you sure that the module is not being loaded?
drivers = modules = have to be loaded
